This original, and in some respects paradoxical, development of hedonism gave no countenance to the voluptuary. On the contrary Epicurus both preached and practised the simple life, and the cultivation of the ordinary virtueS, though under utilitarian sanc· tions which led him to extreme unorthodoxy in some particulare. Especially, he denied any absolute validity to J ustice and to Law, and inculcated absten- tion from the active duties of citizenship.
